holidays.name: Dance Like a Chicken Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day encouraging everyone to break out their best chicken dance moves and embrace their inner poultry.
holidays.origin: Popularized in the 1980s as a parody of dance crazes, it gained unofficial recognition online as a fun way to bring laughter and silliness.

holidays.origin: Rooted in American Southern cuisine, this day honors the biscuits that have been a breakfast favorite for generations.

holidays.name: International Thrift Shop Day
holidays.description: An eco-friendly observance encouraging people to shop sustainably, discover vintage treasures, and support second-hand stores.
holidays.origin: Created by sustainability advocates to promote recycling clothing and reducing consumer waste.
holidays.funFact: Shopping at thrift stores can reduce your carbon footprint by up to 60% compared to buying new clothes!

holidays.name: Lost Sock Memorial Day
holidays.description: A lighthearted day commemorating socks lost in the laundry abyss, honoring those single socks who've mysteriously disappeared.
holidays.origin: An informal, humorous observance created by sock manufacturers and laundry enthusiasts to bring attention to a universally frustrating phenomenon.
holidays.funFact: Studies estimate the average person loses about 1.3 socks per week to the mysterious void of the laundry.
